intro: Ornithogalum otavense, commonly known as the Otavense Star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, forming a basal rosette, while its flowering stem rises above the foliage. Ornithogalum otavense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
